alert.note: Alert for Camden; Eastern Currituck; Pasquotank; Western Currituck (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 3:21PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Camden, eastern Pasquotank and southeastern Currituck Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 320 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Old Trap, or near Grandy, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Grandy, Sanderling, Old Trap, Indiantown, Shiloh, Corolla, Point Harbor, Poplar Branch, Spot, Aydlett, Harbinger, Jarvisburg, Coinjock, Powells Point, Riddle, Texas, Bertha, Goose Creek, Bartlett and Mamie. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Camden; Eastern Currituck; Pasquotank; Western Currituck
